intro: Chorizanthe vaseyi, commonly known as the Vasey's choris, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Amaranthaceae family and is characterized by its erect, branched stems and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments. Its foliage is often gray-green, with narrow, linear leaves that help reduce water loss. Chorizanthe vaseyi is a hardy, drought-tolerant species that thrives in full sun.
